title: Double Exclamation Mark

adjectives: Feeling that something unexpected has happened.
Excessively emotional, excited, aroused or angry.
verbs: To give public notice, or first notice of; to make known; to publish; to proclaim.
To make known by stating or announcing.
To give public notice, or first notice of.
nouns: Feeling that something unexpected has happened.
Unexpected.
A sudden unexpected event
The marks used to clarify meaning by indicating separation of words into sentences and clauses and phrases
Symbols that indicate the structure and organization of written language, as well as intonation and pauses
In written language
A written sign used to mark the structure of a written text; either in between sentences or within sentences.
A set of symbols and marks which are used to clarify meaning in text by separating strings of words into clauses, phrases and sentences.
Set of symbols.
Punctuation is "the use of spacing, conventional signs, and certain typographical devices as aids to the understanding and correct reading, both silently and aloud, of handwritten and printed texts."
The symbol ! (an exclamation mark).
A mark or sign by which outcry or emphatic utterance is marked; thus !; – also called an exclamation point.
Mark or sign by which outcry or emphatic utterance is marked.
The exclamation mark or exclamation point is a punctuation mark usually used after an interjection or exclamation to indicate strong feelings or high volume, and often marks the end of a sentence.
Punctuation mark “!” (used to denote excitement, surprise or shock).
The punctuation mark"!"
A mark or sign by which outcry or emphatic utterance is marked.
A punctuation mark (!) used after an exclamation
A symbol is an object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, visual image, belief, action, or material entity.
Symbols are things such as particular forms or marks which represent some sort of information, an idea, a physical entity or a process but is distinct from it.
In programming, a name that represents a register, an absolute value, or a memory address (relative or absolute).
A character or glyph representing an idea, concept or object.
One or a few characters, a picture or an other concrete representation of an idea, a concept and the like.
An object that represents, stands for, or suggests an idea, belief, action, or material entity
Character or glyph.
An arbitrary sign (written or printed) that has acquired a conventional significance
Something that represents an idea, a process, or a physical entity

description: Two large red exclamation mark (!) symbols placed side-by-side (!!).
apple_vendor_description: The double exclamation mark emoji on Apple devices stands out with bold, impactful typography, rendered in a vibrant red that immediately grabs attention. Its strong, solid form is enhanced by a subtle glossy highlight, adding a touch of Apple's signature 3D polish. This emoji on Apple devices signifies urgency, excitement, or strong emphasis, effectively amplifying the emotional weight of a message and ensuring it’s noticed.
